content.question:
Substance
 <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Initial concentration <math alttext="in molarity" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 2.0
 0.0

Equilibrium concentration <math alttext="in molarity" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 1.2
 0.80

The diagram above represents the equilibrium between the two isomers of <math alttext="C 2 H 2 C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the table provides the data collected in an experiment to determine its equilibrium constant, <math alttext="K sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, at <math alttext="490 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>490</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. In a second experiment done at the same temperature, <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Z is approximately equal to 1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Z]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the approximate equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the second experiment, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Y is approximately equal to 1.4 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Y minus the equilibrium molar concentration of Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[Z]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> should be the same for the same reaction.

<math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Y is approximately equal to 1.5 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because the ratio <math alttext="the fraction the equilibrium molar concentration of Z over the equilibrium molar concentration of Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> should remain constant when the reaction is done at the same temperature.

<math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Y is approximately equal to 1.6 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.6</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because the ratio <math alttext="the fraction the initial molar concentration of Y over the equilibrium molar concentration of Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> should remain constant when the reaction is done at the same temperature.

<math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Y is approximately equal to 2.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the initial molar concentration of Y minus the equilibrium molar concentration of Y, is equal to the initial molar concentration of Z minus the equilibrium molar concentration of Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> should be the same for the same reaction.

content.answer: <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of Y is approximately equal to 1.5 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because the ratio <math alttext="the fraction the equilibrium molar concentration of Z over the equilibrium molar concentration of Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Z</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>Y</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> should remain constant when the reaction is done at the same temperature.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
